licence_overview:
$!You must have a licence to run a leisure boat business on [Canal & River Trust (CRT)](http://canalrivertrust.org.uk/ "Canal & River Trust website") controlled waters.$!

You'll need a licence to use a boat for:

* passenger trips
* day hire
* holiday hire
* floating restaurants

^You must renew your licence every 12 months.^

##Conditions

Before applying for a licence, you must make sure your:

* boat meets the CRT’s construction and equipment standards
* boat has home moorings
* insurance covers third-party liability up to at least £1 million

$D
[Download 'The CRT's standards for boat construction and equipment' form (PDF 25KB)](http://canalrivertrust.org.uk/media/library/682.pdf "Download 'The CRT's standards for boat construction and equipment' form (PDF 25KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

If your boat can hold [12 passengers or less](http://canalrivertrust.org.uk/boating/boating-businesses/starting-a-new-boating-business/skippered-passenger-boat-up-to-12-passengers "Skippered passenger boat (up to 12 passengers)"){:rel="external"}, you must complete a declaration of compliance to send with your application.

$D
[Download 'The CRT's declaration of compliance' form (PDF 132KB)](http://canalrivertrust.org.uk/media/library/417.pdf "Download 'The CRT's declaration of compliance' form (PDF 132KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

If your boat can hold [13 passengers or more](http://canalrivertrust.org.uk/boating/boating-businesses/starting-a-new-boating-business/skippered-passenger-boat-13-or-more-passengers "Skippered passenger boat (13 or more passengers)"){:rel="external"}, you must get a passenger certificate from the Marine and Coastguard Agency (MCA) to send with your application.

[Contact your local MCA office](http://www.dft.gov.uk/mca/mcga07-home/shipsandcargoes/mcga-shipsurveysandinspecs/dops_-_all-surv-insp-mo-contact_details.htm "MCA marine office contacts"){:rel="external"} for detailed advice on how to get the right passenger certificate for your boat.

##How to apply

Complete a [business boat licence application](http://canalrivertrust.org.uk/boating/boating-businesses/application-process-and-fees "Application process and fees"){:rel="external"} and send this to the address below:

$D
[Download 'The CRT's business craft licence' form (PDF 383KB)](http://canalrivertrust.org.uk/media/library/416.pdf "Download 'The CRT's business craft licence' form (PDF 383KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

$A
Boat Licensing Team
PO Box 162
Leeds
LS9 1AX
$A

You can also send this to them by email or call them on the number below:

$C 
**Boat Licensing Team**  
<customer.services@canalrivertrust.org.uk>  
**Telephone:** 0303 040 4040  
$C

You'll have to pay an application fee, which changes based on how many passengers your boat can hold.

##Displaying your licence

You must display your licence on both sides of your boat (the CRT will provide you with 2 copies of this).

##Penalties and fines

If you run a leisure boat business without a licence, your boat may be confiscated and sold or destroyed.

*[CRT]: Canal & River Trust
*[MCA]: Marine and Coastguard Agency
licence_short_description: A business boat licence lets you run a leisure boat business on Canal & River Trust controlled waters.
